Job Posting: 177959 - Position: S26 Summer Student - Programmer Developer/Integrator Assistant 177959 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/28/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 02/02/2026 02:51 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country City of Ottawa 110 Laurier Avenue West, 5th Flr Ottawa K1P 1J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Summer Student - Programmer Developer/Integrator Assistant 177959 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 or 8 months CAD 18.45 per hour for 35 Major List $18.451? - $19.940?per hour Job Title: Summer Student - Programmer Developer/Integrator Assistant Job ID: 20711 Application Deadline: February 28, 2026 JOB SUMMARY Applications Management is responsible for planning and managing the full lifecycle and day-to-day delivery and operations of multiple, complex enterprise-wide applications, web applications and services, and over 170 business-specific applications managed by Information Technology Services for use by specific client departments, the corporation and/or the public. Under the direction of a Project Manager in Applications Management, you work as a team member on a number of client server based applications to support internal client requirements at the City. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. The City of Ottawa promotes the principles of diversity and inclusion and adheres to the tenets of the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. We encourage applications from members of Indigenous, Black and other racialized communities, persons with disabilities, women and non-binary persons, persons of all ethnic origins, religions, sexual orientations, classes, gender identities and expressions. Candidates are encouraged to self-identify as a member of one or more designated employment equity groups in the self- identification questionnaire. The City of Ottawa provides accommodation to applicants during all parts of the hiring process, upon request. If contacted to proceed to the selection process, please advise us if you require any accommodation. Accessible formats and communication supports are available upon request. Please contact the Employee Service Centre at 613- 580-2424 extension 12211 or via email at esc-cse@ottawa.ca. Job Requirements EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Post-secondary Student - completion of first year college or university in Computer Science or related field Minimum of 4 months but less than 8 months of related experience is required, including courses in school, 6 months of experience in the computer/systems field Software development experience is an asset KNOWLEDGE • Knowledge of Windows based development techniques; any of the technologies below, web applications, client/server architecture, and database design is an asset. • Technologies used include Microsoft Visual Studio.NET, PowerBuilder, Oracle Internet Developer Suite, Cognos Tool set, Web graphics tools, SQL, MS-Access, Visual Basic, MS Office, Windows 95/98/NT/2000/XP, SQL Server, and Oracle 8/9i, SAP COMPETENCIES, SKILLS AND ABILITIES • works well with work team • requires little supervision works well with clients • WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW • Language Requirement: Various language requirements, locations may require English only, French only OR Bilingual competencies. Some positions require English oral, reading, and writing. Some positions required French oral, reading and writing. Please save a copy of the job poster. Once the closing date has passed, it will no longer be available. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
